utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: This is unbelievable. It’s been like a half an hour. If this was a cartoon, you’d be looking like a ham right about now.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: There’s the waitress. Excuse me, Miss. Hello, Miss?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: It’s Phoebe! Hi!

utterance.speaker: Ursula
utterance.content: Hi. Okay, will that be all?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Wait, wait! Wh-what are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: Ursula
utterance.content: Yeah, um, I was over there, then you said, "Excuse me, hello Miss," so now I’m here.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No, no... how come you are working here?

utterance.speaker: Ursula
utterance.content: Right, yeah, ’cause its close to where I live, and the aprons are really cute.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Can we start over?

utterance.speaker: Ursula
utterance.content: Yeah. Okay great. I’m gonna be over here.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I don’t know whether he’s testing me, or just acting out, but my monkey is out of control. But, he keeps erasing the messages on my machine, "supposedly" by accident.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No, yeah, I’ve done that.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: And then, like three days in a row he got to the newspaper before I did, and peed all over the crossword.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I’ve never done that.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: All right, now look at her and tell me she doesn’t look exactly like her sister.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I’m sayin’ I see a difference.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: They’re twins!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I don’t care. Phoebe’s Phoebe. Ursula’s... hot!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You know that thing, when you and I talk to each other about things?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Let’s not do that any more.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Hey guys! Hey!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey Pheebs, guess who we saw today.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ooh, ooh, fun! Okay... um, Liam Neeson.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Nope.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Morly Safer.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Nope.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: The woman who cuts my hair!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, look, this could be a really long game.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Your sister Ursula.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, really.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, she works over at that place, uh...

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Rift’s. Yeah, I know.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, you do? Because she said you guys haven’t talked in like years.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hmmm? Yeah. So, um, is she fat?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Not from where I was standin’.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: where were you standing?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Um, Pheebs, so, you guys just don’t get along?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: It’s mostly just dumb sister stuff, you know, I mean, like, everyone always thought of her as the pretty one, you know... Oh, oh, she was the first one to start walking, even though I did it... later that same day. But, to my parents, by then it was like "yeah, right, well what else is new?"

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, Pheebs, I’m sorry, I’ve got to go. I’ve got Lamaze class.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, and I’ve got Earth Science, but I'll catch you in Gym.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: So, is this just gonna be you and Carol?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, Susan’s gonna be there too. We’ve got dads, we’ve got lesbians, the whole parenting team.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, isn’t, isn’t that gonna be weird?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, no. I mean, it mighta been at first, but by now I, I think I’m pretty comfortable with the whole situation.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ross, that’s my jacket.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: Woman
utterance.content: Hi, we’re the Rostins. Err, I’m J.C., and he’s Michael, and we’re having a boy, and a girl.

utterance.speaker: Teacher
utterance.content: Good for you. Alrighty, next?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hi, um, I’m err, I’m Ross Geller, and err ah... ..that’s, that’s my boy in there, and uh, this is Carol Willick, and this... is Susan Bunch. Susan is um Carol’s, just, com... ..who’s next?

utterance.speaker: Teacher
utterance.content: I’m sorry, I didn’t get... Susan is?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Susan is Carol’s, Carol’s, Carol’s, friend...

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: Life partner.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Like buddies.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: Like lovers.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You know how close women can get.

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: Susan and I live together.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Although I was married to her.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: Carol, not me.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Err, right.

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: It’s a little complicated.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: A little.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: But we’re fine.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Absolutely. So, twins... hah! That’s like two births. Ouch.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: And to you too, Helen.

utterance.speaker: Helen
utterance.content: Nina Bookbinder is here to see you.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, okay. Send her in.

utterance.speaker: Nina
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hi, Nina. Come on in.

utterance.speaker: Nina
utterance.content: You wanted to see me?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Uh, Yes. Yes. I’ve just been going over your data here, and little thing, you’ve been post-dating your Friday numbers.

utterance.speaker: Nina
utterance.content: Which is bad, because?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, it throws my WENUS out of whack.

utterance.speaker: Nina
utterance.content: Your... excuse me?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: WENUS. Weekly Estimated Net...

utterance.speaker: Nina
utterance.content: Oh, Net Usage Statistics, right. Gotcha, gotcha. Won’t happen again. I wouldn’t want to do anything to hurt your... "wenus."

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: It’s not just that she’s cute, okay. It’s just that... she’s really really cute.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: It doesn’t matter. You don’t dip your pen in the company ink.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ross, your little creature’s got the remote again.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Marcel, Marcel, give Rossie the remote. Marcel. Marcel, you give Rossie the remote right now... Marce... you give Rossie the remote...

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Great.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Relax, I’ll fix it.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Cool... "Urkel" in Spanish is "Urkel."

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: How did he do this?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So tell me something, is leaving the Christmas lights up part of your plan to keep us merry all year long?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ah no, you see, someone was supposed to take them down around New Year’s... but obviously someone forgot.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well, someone was supposed to write "Rach, take down the lights" and put it on the re... frigerate... How long has that been there?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey, where you been?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I went back to Riff’s. I think Ursula likes me. All I ordered was coffee, she brought me a tuna melt and four plates of curly fries.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Score.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: She is so hot!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, listen. Okay, before you do anything Joey-like, you might wanna run it by err...

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Pheebs?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You think it would be okay if I asked out your sister?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Why? Why would you wanna... do that? Why?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: So that if we went out on a date, she’d be there.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, I mean, I’m not my sister’s, you know, whatever, and um... I mean, it’s true, we were one egg, once, but err, you know, we’ve grown apart, so, um... I don’t know, why not? Okay.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Cool, thanks.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah I’m fine.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You wanna watch Laverne y Shirley?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Sorry.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hi. Sorry I’m late. Where’s, where’s Carol?

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: Stuck at school. Some parent-teacher thing. You can go. I’ll get the information.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No... No... No. I think I should stay, I think we should both know what’s going on.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: Oh, good. This’ll be fun.

utterance.speaker: Teacher
utterance.content: Alrighty. We’re gonna start with some basic third stage breathing exercises, so Mummies, why don’t you get on your back? And... coaches, you should be supporting Mummy’s head.

utterance.speaker: Ross and Susan
utterance.content: What? What? What?

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: I am supposed to be the mommy?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, I’m gonna play my sperm card one more time.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: Look, I don’t see why I should have to miss out on the coaching training just because I’m a woman.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I see. So what do you propose to do?

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: I will flip you for it.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Flip me for it? No, no, no... heads, heads, heads!

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: On your back... Mom.

utterance.speaker: Teacher
utterance.content: Alright, Mommies, take a nice deep cleansing breath.

utterance.speaker: Teacher
utterance.content: Good. Now imagine your vagina is opening like a flower.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Mr. D, how’s it going, sir?

utterance.speaker: Mr. Douglas
utterance.content: Ohh, it’s been better. The Annual Net Usage Statistics are in.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: And?

utterance.speaker: Mr. Douglas
utterance.content: It’s pretty ugly. We haven’t seen an ANUS this bad since the seventies.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: So what does this mean?

utterance.speaker: Mr. Douglas
utterance.content: Well, we’re gonna be layin’ off people in every department.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey, listen, I know I came in late last week, but I slept funny, and my hair was very very

utterance.speaker: Mr. Douglas
utterance.content: Not you. Relax. Ever have to fire anyone?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Nina? Nina. Nina. Nina.

utterance.speaker: Nina
utterance.content: Are you okay?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes, yes I am. Err, listen, the reason that I called you in here today was, err... please don’t hate me.

utterance.speaker: Nina
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Would you like to have dinner sometime?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: So Pheebs, what do you want for your birthday?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, what I really want is for my mom to be alive and enjoy it with me.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay... Let me put it this way. Anything from Crabtree and Evelyn?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ooh! Bath salts would be nice.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Ooh, okay... good.

utterance.speaker: Jamie
utterance.content: What is this place?

utterance.speaker: Fran
utterance.content: Look, you’re cold, I have to pee, and... ..there’s a cup of coffee on the window. How bad could it be?

utterance.speaker: Jamie
utterance.content: I think we have an answer.

utterance.speaker: Fran
utterance.content: What’s she doing here?

utterance.speaker: Jamie
utterance.content: This could be God’s way of telling us to eat at home.

utterance.speaker: Fran
utterance.content: Think she got fired at Riff’s?

utterance.speaker: Jamie
utterance.content: No, no, no. We were there last night. She kept... ..bringing swordfish. are you gonna go to the, um?

utterance.speaker: Fran
utterance.content: I’m gonna wait till after we order. It’s her, right.

utterance.speaker: Jamie
utterance.content: It looks like her.

utterance.speaker: Jamie
utterance.content: Um, excuse me.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Jamie
utterance.content: Hi, it’s us.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Right, and it’s me.

utterance.speaker: Jamie
utterance.content: So, so you’re here too?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Much as you are.

utterance.speaker: Jamie
utterance.content: Your turn.

utterance.speaker: Fran
utterance.content: Err... we know what we want.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, that’s good.

utterance.speaker: Jamie
utterance.content: All we want is two Caffe Lattes.

utterance.speaker: Fran
utterance.content: And some biscotti cookies.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Good choice.

utterance.speaker: Jamie
utterance.content: Definitely her.

utterance.speaker: Fran
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I can’t believe you. You still haven’t told that girl she doesn’t have a job yet?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, you still haven’t taken down the Christmas lights.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Congratulations, I think you’ve found the world’s thinnest argument.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I’m just trying to find the right moment, you know?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, well, that shouldn’t be so hard, now that you’re dating. "Sweetheart, you’re fired, but how ’bout a quickie before I go to work?"

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Rachel and Chandler
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You know, once you’re inside, you don’t have to knock any more.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I’ll get it.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh. Hi, Mr.Heckles.

utterance.speaker: Mr.Heckles
utterance.content: You’re doing it again.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: We’re not doing anything. We’re just sitting around talking, quietly.

utterance.speaker: Mr.Heckles
utterance.content: I can hear you through the ceiling. My cats can’t sleep.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You don’t even have cats.

utterance.speaker: Mr.Heckles
utterance.content: I could have cats.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Goodbye Mr.Heckles.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: We’ll try to keep it down.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Phoebe, could you do me a favour? Could you try this on? I just wanna make sure it fits.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ooh, my first birthday present... ..oh, this is really...

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, no no no. It’s for Ursula. I just figured, you know, size-wise.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Ohhh... Sure, yeah... ..okay, it fits.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Are you seein’ her again tonight?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yep. Ice Capades.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Wow, this is serious. I’ve never known you to pay money for any kind of capade.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I don’t know. I like her, you know. She’s different. There’s uh, somethin’ about her.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: That you like, we get it. You like her. Great!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Hey, Phoebe, I asked you, and you said it was okay.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Alright, well, maybe now it’s not okay.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay... Well maybe now I’m not okay with it not being okay.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Knit, good woman, knit, knit!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: And that’s the Chrysler Building right there.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Douglas
utterance.content: Nina.

utterance.speaker: Nina
utterance.content: Mr.Douglas... ..cool tie.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Douglas
utterance.content: She’s still here.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes, yes she is. Didn’t I memo you on this? See, after I let her go, err, I got a call from her psychiatrist, Dr. Flanen-nen, Dr. Flanen, Dr. Flan.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: And err, he informed me that uh, she took the news rather badly, in fact, he uh, mentioned the word frenzy.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Douglas
utterance.content: You’re kidding? She seems so...

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, no, no. Nina... ..she is whooo wewee-woo whoo whoo! In fact, if you asked her right now, she would have no recollection of being fired at all, none at all.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Douglas
utterance.content: That’s unbelievable.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: And yet, believable. So I decided not to fire her again until I can be assured that she will be no threat to herself, or others.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Douglas
utterance.content: I see. I guess you never really know what’s goin’ on inside a person’s head.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, I guess that’s why they call it psychology, sir.

utterance.speaker: Soothing male voice
utterance.content: ..a sound Mom and Dad never forget. For this after all, is the miracle of birth.

utterance.speaker: Teacher
utterance.content: Lights please? And that’s having a baby. Next week is our final class.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Susan, go deep.

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: This is impossible. It’s just impossible.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: What is, honey?

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: What that woman... did. I am not doin’ that. It’s just gonna have to stay in, that’s all, everything will be the same, it’ll just stay in.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Carol, honey, shhh, shhh, everything’s gonna be alright.

utterance.speaker: Carol
utterance.content: OH, WHAT DO YOU KNOW? NO-ONE’S GOING UP TO YOU AND SAYING, "HI, IS THAT YOUR NOSTRIL? MIND IF WE PUSH THIS POT ROAST THROUGH IT?"

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: Carol, Carol, sweetie. Cleansing breath.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: I know it’s frightening, but, big picture. The birth part is just one day, and when it’s over, we’re all gonna be parents for the rest of our lives.

utterance.speaker: Susan
utterance.content: I mean, that’s what this is all about, right? Ross? Ross?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I’m gonna be a father.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: This is just occurring to you?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I always knew I was havin’ a baby, I just never realised the baby was having me.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, you’re gonna be great!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Aw, how can you say that? I can’t even get Marcel to stop eating the bath mat. How am I gonna raise a kid?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You know, Ross, some scientists are now saying that, that monkeys and babies are actually different.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Where’re you going?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Out.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: With?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Alright, could I just ask you one question?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Have you two, you know... like... you know... you know... yet?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, not that it’s any of your business, but, no, we haven’t, okay?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: You meant sex, right?

utterance.speaker: Nina
utterance.content: Do you have a sec?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ah, sure, Nina. What’s up?

utterance.speaker: Nina
utterance.content: I don’t know. For the past couple days, people have been avoiding me and giving me these really strange looks.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, well, ah... maybe that’s because they’re ah... jealous, of us.

utterance.speaker: Nina
utterance.content: Maybe. But that doesn’t explain why they keep taking my scissors.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Ah, well, maybe that’s, ah, because you’re getting a big raise.

utterance.speaker: Nina
utterance.content: I am?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Sure, why not?

utterance.speaker: Nina
utterance.content: Oh my god! You’re amazing!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, you don’t know. Helen, could you make sure we put through the paperwork on Miss Bookbinder’s raise?

utterance.speaker: Helen
utterance.content: So you still want me to send her psychological profile to Personnel?

utterance.speaker: Nina
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Helen drinks. Will you marry me?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well, I ended up telling her everything.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, how’d she take it?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Pretty well. Except for the stapler thing. Little tip: if you’re ever in a similar situation, never ever leave your hand... ..on the desk.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, I think I get how to do this.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Alright, so, can we turn this off? Can we just make it... make them go away? Because I can’t, I can’t watch.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: okay, Pheebs, they’re gone.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Are you alright?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah. It’s just, you know, it’s this whole stupid Ursula thing, it’s...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, Pheebs, can I ask? So, he’s going out with her. I mean, is it really so terrible?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Um, yeah. Look, I mean, I’m not saying she’s like evil or anything. She just, you know, she’s always breaking my stuff. When I was eight, and I wouldn’t let her have my Judy Jetson thermos, so she threw it under the bus. And then, oh, and then there was Randy Brown, who was like... Have you ever had a boyfriend who was like your best friend?

utterance.speaker: Monica and Rachel
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Well, but that’s what he was for me. And she you know, kind of stole him away, and then... broke his heart... and then he wouldn’t even talk to me any more. Because he said he didn’t wanna be around... anything that looked like either one of us.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh... Oh, Pheebs.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I mean, I know Joey is not my boyfriend, or my thermos, or anything, but...

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You’re not gonna lose him.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Hon, you gotta talk to Joey.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah. Okay.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, come on, he doesn’t know this stuff. If he knew how you felt.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: But he’s falling in love with her.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh please, they’ve been going out a week. They haven’t even slept together yet, I mean, that’s not serious.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay... Okay.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Oh, okay, oh.

utterance.speaker: Ursula
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: Ursula
utterance.content: Yeah, um, may we help you?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Rachel, what are you doing? It’s freezing out here. Would you come back inside?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No no no no no. You wanted me to take them down, so... ..I’m takin’ ’em down. Okay? Whoa!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh-my-god Rachel! Rachel!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I’m okay! I’m okay! Mr. Heckles, Mr. Heckles could you help me please?

utterance.speaker: Mr.Heckles
utterance.content: See, this is just the kind of thing I was talking about.
